intro: Senecio michoacanus, commonly known as the Michoacan groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy and grayish-green, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Senecio michoacanus is often found in rocky soils and is a part of the native flora in central Mexico.
